channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024040883
item.description:
Report X-2024040883

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was reported to QA that it sounded like the contents was loose and shifting. package was put in a hazmat bag and tote and brought back to the QA desk for inspection. DescribePack: It was found that there were no signs of damage or leakage on the outer box however, an inspection of the inner plastic pail reveled that the bottom was cracked and leaking. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Contents was transferred to a hazmat bag and drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was dropped and side of inner canister was dented as a result. DescribePack: Box is dented at two of the top corners and wet due to inner leaking. There is no other damage to the box. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Box was immediately placed in a bagged bin.

item.title: Report E-2024040405
item.description:
Report E-2024040405

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: NEW HYDE PARK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a roadside release at a customer’s site. Approximately 4-gallons of product released in the trailer and onto the asphalt beneath the trailer. One jerrican containing Kleen AC9507 was punctured by a pallet during transit. A Contractor estimated that the trailer floor was impacted in a 5'x3' area and that the asphalt was impacted in a 20'x3' area. The Contractor neutralized the release using baking soda and containerized the spill debris, damaged product, and PPE into one 55-gallon poly drum for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.
